LCS423.name: Principles of Fish and Wildlife Disease
LCS423.description: Diseases of fish and wildlife species. Disease detection and diagnosis. Ecological and epidemiological analysis and management of major classes of wildlife diseases. Threatened and endangered species, game species, and fish and wildlife species that serve as vectors or reservoirs of human and domestic animal diseases.
LCS423.prerequisite: (BS 162 and BS 172) or (BS 182H and BS 192H) or LB 144
LCS423.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources or in the College of Natural Science or in the College of Veterinary Medicine or approval of department.

LCS423L.name: Principles of Fish and Wildlife Disease Laboratory
LCS423L.description: Tools for diagnosis and assessment of disease in fish and wildlife populations.

LCS463.name: Wildlife Disease Ecology
LCS463.description: Role of wildlife disease in ecological interactions. Factors underlying pathogen emergence. Disease modeling. Conservation medicine.
LCS463.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or approval of department.

LCS560.name: Clinical Competencies II
LCS560.description: Basic diagnostics and therapeutics for application to large animal practice.
LCS560.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS562.name: Care and Management of the Neonatal Foal
LCS562.description: Weekly seminars focusing on common diseases. Case presentations.
LCS562.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS563.name: Bovine Pregnancy Diagnosis
LCS563.description: Basic reproductive physiology. Farm based laboratories in bovine transrectal palpation and sonography. Field trips required.
LCS563.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS564.name: Nutritional Management of Dairy Cow Health
LCS564.description: Diet formulation for promotion of dairy cow health and prevention of peripartum disease.
LCS564.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS565.name: Equine Sports Medicine
LCS565.description: Physiologic responses to exercise and discipline specific disorders of equine athletes.
LCS565.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS566.name: Current Topics in Food Systems Veterinary Medicine
LCS566.description: Techniques in management, interpretation and application of new knowledge in the scientific literature of food systems veterinary medicine.
LCS566.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine and open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS568.name: Biological Risk Management for Beef and Dairy Farms
LCS568.description: Principles and methods used to reduce the introduction and spread of infectious disease agents on beef and dairy farms. Field trip required.
LCS568.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS569.name: Sport Horse Evaluation, Rehabilitation and Therapy
LCS569.description: Hands-on diagnostic evaluation and treatment of the equine athlete. Traditional medical approaches, acupuncture, and chiropractic manipulation.
LCS569.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS590.name: Selective Topics in Large Animal Clinical Sciences
LCS590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LCS590.description: Important field of study in Large Animal Clinical Sciences.
LCS590.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS610.name: Clinical Problems in Large Animal Clinical Sciences
LCS610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS610.description: Advanced clinical training in a problem related to large animal clinical sciences.

LCS611.name: Research Problems in Large Animal Clinical Sciences
LCS611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS611.description: Research related to a large animal specialty.

LCS613.name: Special Problems in Large Animal Clinical Sciences at Off-Campus Sites
LCS613.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS613.description: Advanced clinical-phase training in large animal clinical sciences for which on-campus training is not available. Individualized problems and training objectives.

LCS614.name: Equine Clinical Proficiency Clerkship
LCS614.description: Field and practitioner-based clinical techniques, training, and hands-on experience for future equine practitioners.
LCS614.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS615.name: Equine Emergency and Critical Care Clerkship
LCS615.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS615.description: Lectures, laboratories, seminars, and emergency on-call clinical case evaluation, treatment, and management.
LCS615.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS616.name: Large Animal Medicine and Surgery
LCS616.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS616.description: Diagnosis and management of individual medical and surgical cases, as part of a veterinary patient care team, in the large animal veterinary teaching hospital and at the Training Center for Dairy Professionals.
LCS616.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS621.name: Practice Based Ambulatory Clerkship
LCS621.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS621.description: Supervised, off-campus experience in an assigned veterinary practice. Regular equine and food animal farm calls. After-hours emergencies. Veterinary practice management.
LCS621.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS622.name: Advanced Equine Clinical Clerkship
LCS622.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS622.description: Advanced general training in equine medicine and surgery.
LCS622.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS623.name: Equine Musculoskeletal Diseases Clerkship
LCS623.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS623.description: Techniques and procedures used for the diagnosis and management of equine musculoskeletal diseases. Hospital and field cases.
LCS623.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS624.name: Equine Theriogenology Clerkship
LCS624.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS624.description: Diagnostic methods used in equine reproduction.
LCS624.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS625.name: Equine Primary Care Clerkship
LCS625.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LCS625.description: Establishment and maintenance of equine herd health programs. Reproduction, parasite control, immunization, and diagnostic medicine and surgery in the field.
LCS625.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine. A student may earn a maximum of 0 credits This course is not reenrollable

LCS626.name: Advanced Equine Surgery Clerkship
LCS626.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS626.description: Advanced, in-depth training in overall surgical management of equine surgical patients. Breeds used for racing or sport.
LCS626.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS627.name: Advanced Equine Medicine Clerkship
LCS627.description: Advanced, in-depth training in the medical management of equine patients. Emphasis on neonates.
LCS627.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS628.name: Techniques in Equine Anesthesia and Surgery
LCS628.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS628.description: Advanced equine anesthesia and surgery. Preoperative care of University-owned equids, induction of anesthesia, and performance of minor surgical procedures.
LCS628.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS631.name: Food Animal Practice Clerkship
LCS631.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS631.description: Supervised, off-campus experience in an assigned veterinary practice. Regular food animal farm calls. After-hours emergencies. Veterinary practice management.
LCS631.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS632.name: Advanced Food Animal Medicine and Surgery Clerkship
LCS632.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS632.description: Principles of diagnostic treatment and prevention of diseases in food animals. Self-directed and in-depth on-farm experience.
LCS632.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS635.name: Swine Production Medicine Clerkship
LCS635.description: Swine production medicine and herd problem-solving topics. Participation in the swine medicine clinical course at Iowa State University. Field trips required.
LCS635.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS638.name: Beef Production Medicine Clerkship
LCS638.description: Veterinary management of production and health of beef cattle. Optional visits to out-of-state facilities may be offered.

LCS639.name: Small Ruminant Medicine and Management Clerkship
LCS639.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS639.description: Health care to small ruminants on an individual and flock or herd basis. Emphasis on sheep.

LCS640.name: Large Animal Anesthesia Clerkship
LCS640.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS640.description: Concepts and supervised practice in large animal anesthesiology.
LCS640.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine. A student may earn a maximum of 0 credits 6 credits

LCS641.name: Food Animal Theriogenology Clerkship
LCS641.description: Techniques for evaluating the reproductive performance of individual food animals and populations, primarily on cattle, but other species including swine and small ruminants.
LCS641.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS646.name: Equine Neonatal Medicine Clerkship
LCS646.description: Principles of breeding farm management. Diagnosis and treatment of equine neonatal disorders. Supervised, in-clinic experience. Elective clerkship.
LCS646.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS647.name: Concepts of Agricultural Practice Clerkship
LCS647.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS647.description: Fundamentals of animal agriculture practice and food systems. Etiology, diagnosis, and prevention of common food animal diseases.

LCS660.name: Wildlife Disease Ecology and Management
LCS660.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LCS660.description: Principles of investigations and management of pathogens at the wildlife, livestock, and human interface. Multidisciplinary teamwork skill and communication, research, management of emerging and resurgent wildlife-borne diseases.
LCS660.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS677.name: Veterinary Preceptorship
LCS677.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS677.description: Applied large animal clinical science in private practices. Supervised off-campus experience.
LCS677.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS678.name: Government and Corporate Veterinary Practice
LCS678.description: Government veterinary practice issues including state, federal and international regulatory medicine, state and federal public health, state and federal wildlife, military veterinary medicine, food safety, and animal control. Study of corporate veterinary practice pertaining to the pharmaceutical and chemical industries.
LCS678.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS679.name: Food Animal Production Medicine I
LCS679.description: Entry-level principles of production medicine as applied to food animal practice.
LCS679.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS682.name: Food Animal Production Medicine II
LCS682.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS682.description: Farm evaluations and group problem- solving. Application and further development of skills and concepts learned in LCS 679.
LCS682.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS685.name: Ruminant Health Problem Solving Clerkship
LCS685.description: The North American dairy industry and the role of veterinarians in health management programs on large versus small dairy herds. Students are required to spend one week at the University of Guelph.
LCS685.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS690.name: Veterinary Public Health Field Experience Clerkship
LCS690.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS690.description: Advanced public health training with individualized problems and training objectives at off campus locations.
LCS690.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or approval of department.

LCS691.name: Veterinary Public Health Research Clerkship
LCS691.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS691.description: Advanced public health research. Individualized problems and training objectives.
LCS691.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS809.name: Special Problems in Large Animal Surgery
LCS809.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS809.description: Elective work in surgical research problems student's interest.
LCS809.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Large Animal Clinical Sciences major. Approval of department.

LCS811.name: Special Problems in Large Animal Medicine
LCS811.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS811.description: Elective work in medicine-related research problems.
LCS811.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Large Animal Clinical Sciences. Approval of department.

LCS813.name: Seminar
LCS813.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LCS813.description: Presentation and discussion of current topics in large animal clinical sciences by departmental graduate students, faculty, or outside speakers.
LCS813.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

LCS821.name: Conservation Medicine
LCS821.description: Ecological and epidemiological principles of wildlife disease impacts and management. Critical review of selected case studies.
LCS821.restrictions: Open to graduate students or approval of department.

LCS829.name: Design and Conduct of Epidemiological Studies and Clinical Trials
LCS829.description: Applied analytical methods in experimental design. Assessment of health and disease status of animal and human populations. Risk assessment and interpretation of clinical trials.

LCS840.name: Advanced Equine Internal Medicine Topics I
LCS840.description: Body system approach to disease with emphasis on physiology and pathophysiology of the respiratory, cardiovascular, musculoskeletal and nervous systems.

LCS841.name: Advanced Equine Internal Medicine Topics II
LCS841.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LCS841.description: Body system approach to disease with emphasis on physiology and pathophysiology of the gastrointestinal, urinary, hematopoietic, and endocrine systems.

LCS863.name: Wildlife Disease Ecology
LCS863.description: Role of wildlife disease in ecological interactions, factors underlying pathogen emergence, mathematical modeling of infectious diseases, conservation medicine.

LCS899.name: Master's Thesis Research
LCS899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS899.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Large Animal Clinical Sciences.

LCS999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
LCS999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LCS999.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the Department of Large Animal Clinical Sciences.
